intro: Eleocharis barrosii, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in dense spikes. It is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Eleocharis barrosii plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
